bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 170, Number 138 (Friday, September 6, 2024)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Ms. STANSBURY:H.R. 9486.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8.The single subject of this legislation is:To establish a grant program within the Small BusinessAdministration to provide funds for eligible accelerators oreligible incubators that provide services to small businessconcerns owned and controlled by women and rural smallbusiness concerns, and for other purposes.[Page H5033]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Small Business.

bill.title: Innovation and Empowerment for Startups Act

item.title: Innovation and Empowerment for Startups Act
Innovation and Empowerment for Startups Act

To establish a grant program within the Small Business Administration to provide funds for eligible accelerators or eligible incubators that provide services to small business concerns owned and controlled by women and rural small business concerns, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Small Business.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
